body:
On 8 Jan 2008, at 22:57, Fitzsimmons, Rob wrote:
> I used a tool from University of Oregon,
> http://solardat.uoregon.edu/SunChartProgram.html
>
> then Photoshop'd my obviously fake green line indicating the sun's  
> position.
> They show up in these figure-8 patterns.
>
> Anyone know a way to produce them?
>
I had a sunpath diagram in my old Blender exporter. The code still
exists but I haven't looked at it in a while. IIRC you could also use
a fisheye image as background (it's the round version with the zenith
at the top, not the one in your image).


I don't think I ever managed PDF output. So all you could create is
a screenshot.




Regards,
Thomas
___
<sup>Automatically generated content from [radiance mailing-list](https://radiance-online.org/pipermail/radiance-general/2008-January/004674.html).</sup>
